⚡【Perfect Learning Activities】The Interesting and unique sensory board will Improving their recognition ability and sensory activity. The board also features a mirror which Will Keep Your child busy on the whole travels

🕹️【Exquisite Sensory Toy】Improves your child's motor skills and problem solving skills. Entertainment for hours with endless buttons, wires and light combinations. This is a very interactive game and is recommended for kids from 1 to 6 years old
👋【Safety & High-Quality】The Wooden busy board are made of natural wood along with the smooth corners and edges will perfectly fit in your child's tiny hands and ensure safe and independent use
🎁【Ideal Perfect Gift】Designed to turn the boring learning process into a creative and fun one. Busy board is amazing for traveling whether if it is a car, a plane indoor or outdoor

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We love this light board!
reviews.reviewText: My daughter was becoming obsessed with light switches so we wanted to find something that would encourage her curiosity in a safe way. It took a few months for her to build up her finger strength to do most of the buttons, as they are a bit stiff (in a good way). She has just recently learned how to turn the bottom yellow and the red plug-which I think are the most difficult on the board. She learned very quickly that if she threw the board, it would not work anymore. When tossing, one of the two batteries may come loose-so you need to unscrew with a screwdriver to reset. This actually helped when she was first using it, to help control her frustration when she couldn’t get one to switch. We recently took our first trip, and this was a must have for the plane! Plenty of fun and distraction, with no annoying sounds. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Engaging and educational for little learners
reviews.reviewText: The wooden sensory board is nicely crafted and sturdy, ensuring it withstands the enthusiastic handling of little hands. Each element on the board, from switches to dials, is designed to stimulate sensory development and fine motor skills.My child is captivated by the variety of activities, and it's wonderful to watch them explore and learn. The board's Montessori principles are evident in its ability to encourage independent play and discovery. Overall, this Busy Board is an good educational toy that provides both fun and learning, making it a worthwhile investment for any toddler's development.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect toy for a bored toddler
reviews.reviewText: Got this for my high energy grandson. He is less than 2 years but was very interested in all of the buttons, switches, and lights. Some of the things were a little hard for him to move with his hands but he figured it out. During this process of discovery, he would get frustrated and throw the the toy. It didn't break after being thrown quite a few times. It is made out of heavy wood so it does hurt when you get hit. Just be aware it you have a toddler who throws things. It would be good if this toy had more and or different light switches, buttons, and a lighter weight wood so grandparents don't get hurt.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fun for toddlers but not toddler proof
reviews.reviewText: I got two— one for my kids and one for my nephew. I figured the wood would be sturdy and even if the batteries run out the kids would still enjoy flipping the switches without the lights.The box says ages 3+ due to choking hazard but I don’t see anything that is an obvious choking hazard. My 1yo and my 3yo love it. The 1yo has been carrying it around nonstop. But it slid off the table once and landed face down (a 3 foot drop) and stopped working. Once I tapped it hard on my hand (face up) it started working again, which made me think either the batteries can knock out of place easily or perhaps some other inner mechanism can. Either way, a toy for toddlers should be a little more drop proof. This has happened more than once so far where I have to “fix” it for the kids because it got dropped or bumped too hard and I basically have to tap the back of it a few times for it to work again. Maybe I’ll try putting a little something in the battery compartment to ensure it’s not the batteries bumping out of place. Annoying, but for the price it’s still quite entertaining for the littles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Make your child smart
reviews.reviewText: This Toy captivate toddlers with engaging activities, fostering fine motor skills and cognitive development. The vibrant colors and diverse tactile elements stimulate curiosity. Sturdy craftsmanship ensures durability, making it a reliable companion for energetic play. Thoughtfully designed with a variety of textures, buttons, and latches, it encourages exploration and problem-solving.The compact size is perfect for little hands, promoting independence. This educational gem strikes a balance between fun and learning, making it an ideal choice for parents seeking enriching playtime experiences. A valuable addition to any toddler's developmental journey.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun hands on learning.
reviews.reviewText: My granddaughter is going on 2 and she loves playing with switches and learning the planets at the same time. I would like to mention some of the switches are a little hard for little fingers to turn off and on but with a little help she’s getting it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for toddlers
reviews.reviewText: This is my 18 month old grandson's favorite toy. It has the perfect blend of colors, lights, sounds, and busy finger buttons.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Try not to drop it!
reviews.reviewText: So much fun for my 2 year old! The only con is you have to be extremely careful not to drop it. We dropped the first one we had and it stopped working. Immediately ordered a second one because he loved it so much. Good entertainment without screens!
